alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 11:27AM EST until December 12 at 5:29PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast, East Central, North Central, and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1127 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Houlton, Millinocket, Howland, Patten, Danforth, Milo, East Millinocket, Medway, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Springfield, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, Lakeville, Sherman Station and Reed Plantation. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
